keyTakeAways: A man named Billy Joe Cagle was arrested at Hartsfield-Jackson Atlanta International Airport after his family alerted authorities that he was armed and planning to 'shoot it up.'
Cagle was not armed at the time of arrest but police discovered an AR-15 assault rifle in his vehicle parked outside the airport.

He faces multiple charges including terroristic threats, criminal attempt to commit aggravated assaults, possession of a firearm in commission of a felony, and possession of a firearm by a convicted felon.
Cagle has a prior conviction for marijuana possession over 20 years ago and is reportedly mentally challenged, according to Atlanta Mayor Andre Dickens.
The FBI is assisting in the investigation, and authorities emphasize that the incident was averted due to early detection by family and police coordination.
Hartsfield-Jackson Atlanta International Airport is the world’s busiest airport, handling over 108 million passengers in 2024 and is a major hub for Delta Air Lines.
The incident underscores the importance of community vigilance and early reporting in preventing mass violence.

summaryOfNewsArticle: A man named Billy Joe Cagle was arrested at Hartsfield-Jackson Atlanta International Airport after his family alerted authorities that he was armed and planning to 'shoot it up.' Though not armed at the time of arrest, police discovered an AR-15 assault rifle in his vehicle. Cagle, who has a prior marijuana conviction and is reportedly mentally challenged, faces multiple charges including terroristic threats and possession of a firearm by a convicted felon. The incident occurred just before 9:30 a.m., with surveillance showing Cagle near the heavily crowded TSA check-in area. Authorities credit the early warning from his family and inter-agency coordination for preventing a potential tragedy. The FBI is assisting in the investigation, and officials from the Atlanta Police Department, Cartersville Police Department, and the city’s mayor emphasized the importance of public vigilance in such high-risk environments. Given that Hartsfield-Jackson is the world’s busiest airport, the event underscores the critical need for proactive security and community awareness.
title: Man Arrested Inside Atlanta Airport After Making Threats to ‘Shoot It Up’
